original_title: DiaTribe: From the Village to the Streets
overview: DiaTribe is a documentary film that explores and celebrates rap music in the United States. It is also a tribute to the evolutionary lineage that exists between African music and dance traditions and the rap music and dance styles of todayâ€™s youth. Ghanaian Master Drummer and Portland, Oregon legend, Obo Addy, Portland hip-hop artist, MC Mic Crenshaw, and poet/director AJ Wone come together to tell this fascinating story. Lively rap and dance performances are showcased throughout the film.
title: DiaTribe: From the Village to the Streets
